text: I was really excited to try BODHI because there was so much hype! The ambience is perfect for date night and the food was tasty. We started with cocktails and crab puffs. The drinks were pretty strong, but good. I had the chili and basil stir-fry and my boyfriend had the roasted chili shrimp stir-fry. Both were good, but I'm excited to get the curry the next time that I go. A few cons though: we waited over an hour and there was no resevration. The stir-fry was good but not exceptional.
name: Sarah

text: DEFINITELY IN MY TOP FIVE BEST PLACES TO EAT IN INDY! Atmosphere: 10/10Drinks: 10/10Food: 100000/10Service: 20/10 Vegetarian Friendly: 10/10 Andrew took the best care of us, recommended the BEST food & was so freakin' kind and funny! I was stuck between the Drunken Noodles & the Chili Basil Stir Fry! I went with the Drunken Noodles & my husband got my second pick (as good hubbies do). I'm telling you... food so good you can't stop eating it! Absolutely unreal! It's not often we name places "our new spot" BUT!... this place... this is it!
name: Cassandra

text: Atmosphere, food and staff were all amazing! The crab puffs put Crab Rangoon I have ever had to shame. Drunken noodles were so tasty as well, and you can adjust the spice level. I would recommend mild for drunken noodles if you don't like spicy food. They also have a super cute patio and some of it is covered from the sun.
name: Lacy

text: Bodhi is small on the inside and has a wonderful patio that's open during the summer. They do a great job of pairing good, traditional Thai food with a trendy aesthetic and super creative cocktail list. The stir fry's are my favorite things on the menu!
name: Mykela

text: Always very pleased to see an independently owned restaurant on mass Ave. this review I write with mixed feelings.  Good set up. Pretty with well spaced tables.  I indeed had a friendly, efficient, knowledgeable wait person. I observed the rest of staff being frenetic, rolling eyes. Unprofessional management. I heard them complaining about the amount of take out orders.  I should not have had to listen to this ungrateful ranting. Food was delicious however not a user friendly menu.  It made ordering very difficult. Normally at a Thai restaurant it is easy to order. This one made no sense.  It was  very expensive for the portion size. Rather weird in fact. And when wanting perhaps a half size of soup for example to accompany a main dish I was told there were take out boxes for the leftovers. Too much attitude for me.  This  delicious food has usually a moderate fair price. I found it way too much money for the value.   And I guess everyone is confused. For the price people should have been dressed not in picnic wear or after the gym. Men wearing baseball caps.  I found it confusing to say the least.
name: Ellen

text: Was lucky enough to stop in for they soft opening.. very nice place I love the outside set up very nicely done. My drink was very good  (sorry name escapes me). I tried the panaag chicken curry... very delicious
name: Hakim

text: The first of its kind in Indianapolis! The drinks were expensive but AMAZING and all of the food was spectacular. The outdoor patio is to die for as well as the tasteful and modern decor inside :) would definitely recommend getting "medium" spice as it's not too spicy.Be sure to find street parking and come hungry. Will definitely be returning.
name: Hannah

text: I forgot to take pictures of my food because it look so good I just wanted to dive in but take my word for it they were delicious!It's a classier twist on Thai food but for the better I had tofu and shrimp pad Thai and it was great also had 2 different cocktails that were very good!If you're looking for a place for date night, girls night or just a Thai night but with a cute vibe this is the place to go! I love the atmosphere and the vibe here, they have food for vegetarian and meatarians so grab everyone and head to Bodhi!
name: Patricia Abigail

text: This place is absolutely outstanding! There's nowhere else like it in Indianapolis. My partner and I recently moved from the NYC area, and until Bodhi came along, we've been having a hard time finding truly notable East Asian restaurants. Not only does Bodhi meet the mark, it surpassed our expectations! We ordered their steak salad which was nothing less than top-of-the-line art cuisine with a memorable taste that I still crave, their "Curry Spaghetti" which I never knew existed but I discovered I've always wanted (this place is the only place I've had anything like this, and I am in love), and we also ordered their Penang Curry which has quickly become our favorite Penang Curry from *any* restaurant we've been to (and we have been to many ...).If you want real Thai food, where each bite takes at least 2 minutes to fully savor, this place is it. Really. I love it. I'm so glad they opened up!! (And, I'm stoked for the drinks ... that menu looks KILLERRRRRR).
name: Leon

text: Located at the end of Mass Ave, Bodhi is the new, trendy Thai spot in town. The interior is beautifully decorated with a garden wall and has a lively atmosphere (reminds me of nyc!) There is very limited indoor and outdoor seating and they don't take reservations. The wait can be up to 2 hours on the weekends so I recommend putting your name down and walking around the Bottleworks District. Bodhi had fun craft cocktails and the food was great. The spring rolls and drunken noodles were my favorite. If you do have a low spice tolerance, I recommend sticking with mild since medium had a delicious but definitely a good kick to it.
name: Natalie

text: Great food and cocktails.  Went for an early dinner and there was already a wait, but the people there were really friendly.  I asked for my meal to be mild, and there was no spice at all, so next time I'll get medium.  Taste and how it was prepared was excellent.  My wife enjoyed hers as well. As other reviews stated, parking is minimal.  Prepare to pay to park and/or walk as little if you can find a free spot down the side road.  There is a great outdoor area and if it was nice out, I would definitely opt to eat outside.
name: Mike

text: SO good. The cocktails are wonderful. The tofu appetizer is one of the best things I've ever eaten. I got the chicken pad Thai, it's probably the best pad Thai I've ever had!
name: Melissa

text: I have eaten here now a few times. I'd have to say I had a more difficult time coming up with a review than most restaurants because what they do well is very good but there are also some dishes that disappoint. Food: The noodle soup is very good. It is authentic and is like something served in Chicago, NYC, Seattle, etc. The broth is spicy with some sourness and sweetness, going best with ground pork. The laab is also pretty good. Nice and mint forward which is always nice! The thai basil (pad ka prao) is served with minced meat which is the authentic style, however, taste is a bit underwhelming. The chicken satay was pretty bad. The chicken seemed undercooked throughout, rubbery, and was just simply not quality. This is a shame because their peanut sauce is homemade and very tasty. Spring rolls also looked great in presentation but almost seemed store bought with a mushy veg mix inside. Overall very mixed, and a bit disappointed they don't incorporate other authentic dishes such as thai sausage, moo ping, Khao moo dang, Khao mun gai, etc. Drinks: very good. When they mention it is a cocktail lounge with thai food, this is a true statement. The cocktails are nuanced and complex, comparing close to other cocktail lounges in the area. Ambiance and service: both great, they did a fantastic job taking over the old black market and renovating it to their own.
name: Jake

text: This is more of a 2nd visit, rather than an 'update'.  There were a few more items on the menu that I wanted to try, from my first visit.  Again, it was a Friday night, walked in, put my name on the list and returned a hour later, at 8:30 p.m.  I was seated, right in front of the window.  Not much of a view other than the highway on the left.Ordered from the 'Savory Bites''Chicken Skewers'(GAI SATAY | grilled curry chicken | peanut sauce | mini cucumber salad)Main entree from the 'Noodles''Pad Thai'(Rice Noodles | tamarind sauce | egg | peanuts | bean sprouts)First, the 'Chicken Skewers' came out on thin wooden sticks but the meat was rather undercooked, for me, at least.  If you like your meat well done, make sure you advise the server of it.  I didn't finish all of them, the server should have noticed.  It also came with a side of 'Peanut Sauce', for dipping and a 'Mini Cucumber Salad' for a side.  The salad could have been a bigger portion of it.The 'Pad Thai' came out hot, with a generous portion of 'Rice Noodles'.  A little to hot, had to wait for it to cool down.  The noodles were tossed with 'Tamarind Sauce', 'Egg', 'Peanuts' and 'Bean Sprouts' on top.  The tamarind sauce and peanuts came together to add a sweet and sour, tangy note to the noodles.
name: Fahad

text: Bodhi has a fun atmosphere, including a patio. Staff is very competent. The neon signs inside are instagrammable as well as their fun cocktail presentations. Like most Thai places, you can choose your spice level. The meals are pretty large, so a typical eater will have a solid lunch leftover box. For the price and the waittimes, I would choose another dinner spot especially for Friday & Saturday. The best time to check out Bodhi is if you go at an unpopular time, like early dinner on Sunday. Parking on the north end of Mass Ave can be tricky, but metered street parking isn't too expensive.
name: Barbara

text: Looking for something new, my foodie friend discovered this gem on Yelp. The remodeled Black Market space has a nice interior atmosphere & makes better use of the patio than the previous restaurateur. We arrived at 8:50 PM to find the place bustling. We were informed "last call" for the kitchen is 9 PM, yet we were promptly seated. There was a delay in getting our order taken, but our server was apologetic & sent a complimentary order of crunchy, delicious spring rolls for our wait (growing pains). My friend had the drunken noodles  & I went with familiar chicken pad Thai . Our cocktails were good. As customers trailed out, the owner  stopped to chat & we complimented the new hideaway at the east end of Mass Ave. The owner explained she, her mother & grandmother have been busy in the kitchen easing into their dine-in opening with a few weeks of carry-out service. She's hopeful to find more staff to help with the obviously successful launch of this Thai restaurant which is designed more as a lounge specializing in craft cocktails, beer & fine wines. Great addition to the vibrant Mass Ave scene! Bodhi Spring RollsDrunken NoodlesPad Thai
name: Paddy

text: So happy something awesome opened up at the old Black Market location! Great atmosphere, great service, food was outstanding and worth the few extra dollars on fresh, family recipes as opposed to fast Thai takeout. Drinks were creative and fun. Can't wait to come back!
name: Nadia

text: Omfg...I don't review very often, but sometimes I'm moved to commit my thoughts to Yelp. I've had Thai food from many local spots over the last year and Bodhi is far and away the best I've had. I've been twice for carryout so far and both times were amazing - shout out to the Massaman Curry! The interior at this spot is amazing and this space (was formerly Black Market) has the best patio in the city. I can't wait to grab cocktails here!!
name: R

text: Great girls night outing! Bodhi is first come first serve as far as seating so keep that in kind when you choose to go. With that being said, we went around 7pm and there was barely a wait. It appears to be this little hidden gem with a great atmosphere and a nice ambiance. We sat on the patio and it was gorgeous. The specialty drinks are all fun and the menu is well crafted! The portion sizes are huge for the price! We tried the sticky tofu appetizer and I must say the sauce was the true star. The tofu was just the vessel for deliciousness. Lol. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because the wait between being seated and receiving even drinks was almost 45 minutes. But other than that it was great!
name: Caitlynn

text: If you haven't been to BODHI yet, add it to your list! The entire experience was wonderful... from the service to the food, and the wonderful outdoor patio. We started with the golden tofu. It was cooked to perfection, and the accompanying sauce was delightful. I had the Pad See Ewe, which was very flavorful with a few simple ingredients. My friend got the Cashew Stir Fry. She said it was delicious, and the spice level was on point. Portions are a nice size, we both had leftovers. If you're getting an adult beverage I highly recommend the François & Étienne. It's the perfect summer drink, that's not too sweet and very light. Will definitely be back soon!
name: Konah

text: We got carryout from here and it was really good! I was not totally sure about getting Thai food from a fancy bar, but it had good reviews so we went for it. This place was really great! The food was ready quickly and it was hot when we picked it up. The tofu pad Thai was great and the portions were big. I would definitely go there again and maybe eat in next time!
name: Mary

text: Truly the best Thai food I've ever had.... Delicious and unique!  I highly recommend the panang curry. Truly interesting and refreshing cocktails. Fantastic service and great atmosphere!
name: Jessica

text: Elevated Thai food. Innovative combinations. Brilliant depth of flavor. Beautiful and delicious cocktails. Attentive service.
name: Karen

text: This is just what Mass Ave needed :) great food + staff works hard! Will be my new spot!!
name: Brandi

text: This place is FIRE. I mean this in two ways: 1) this food is delicious2) If you aren't prepared for super spicy, order medium or mild. I (a spice loving person) ordered the Thai Green Curry, spicy, and boy it melted me. Some of the best curry I've ever eaten, but wow that was hot! Lol
name: Henry

text: Absolutely delicious food and drinks, and a lively fun and young space to go! Great music choices too! Can't wait to try more. Mass Ave needed this!!
name: Jillian

text: Downtown Indianapolis area really needed a good sit-down Thai restaurant where you can enjoy cocktails too. Happy to see this one on the block! I've been to Bodhi twice now and it's definitely a great place to meet a friend or go on a date. It's fairly quite and is perfect for an intimate dinner. What adds glamor is their decor and extensive bar menu. Parking is a bit tough there but you can find street parking spots within few blocks. I have tried their Tom Yum soup, Drunken Noodles and a Chili Basil Stir Fry and they all tasted delicious. When you ask for medium hot, know that it will be medium hot. They do not underestimate their spice levels. Drunken Noodles was my personal favorite because of their wide rice noodles that are made in-house and taste very fresh. The only issue here is that they only open in the evening and you will often have to wait for 20-30 minutes for a table if you arrive after 6:30pm AND they do not accept reservations. They do have a patio but it's a weather-permitting option, so plan for a wait. They've recently partnered with the Gallery Pastry bar for their dessert selection. In the bar menu, I tried the Thai Iced Tea cocktail and would recommend if you're a Thai iced tea fan in general. It's a bit pricey compared to other Thai restaurants but you will get a great dining experience!
name: Maks

text: This is the best Thai food we have eaten anywhere.  Every dish was beautifully presented and mouthwateringly flavorful.  Restaurant  is  sophisticated and high-end.  We will be back soon.
name: robert

text: Amazing. That's the first word that comes to mind when I think about this place. I have heard because it's not a large place it's hard to get in, but thankfully we were able to get a table for 3 right away. We sat outside and it has an amazing patio with a fire pit which has lounge chairs around. The we all ordered different meals so we could sample. My fav was the Pad Thai. Nice size portions and very fresh. Many Thai places have noodles that are sticky. Not theirs. Very fresh. Service was amazing, cocktails 10/10. Highly recommend.
name: Sheree

text: Great lil spot for dinner.  Locally Owned and Operated.  Great craft cocktails and a nice beer and wine list.  Started with the fried tofu and crab puffs accompanied by Flavorful sauces.  Both were fried crisp but there were a lil room any white onions in the puffs for my palate.  The basil stir fry was nice not extraordinary but tasty.  Portion sizes were as expected and filling.  I would return and would return to the covered patio. It fills up quick and for good reason.  Bree our server was Informative, friendly and attentive.  Great job Bodhi!Shop Local, Eat Local, Live Local JC
name: Jim

text: Long live the theater!From the fabulously intimidating hostess (fully in command and committed to her role) that greeted us to the ensemble cast of servers this was a great experience made even better by a charming,well appointed and professional staff! Great ambiance and great food!
name: Douglas

text: Really enjoyed the lovely patio covered in greenery and soft lighting. The inventive cocktail list set the tone  for a great meal. I enjoyed the pad Thai but there were many other items I wanted to try.  Great drinks, wonderful environment and of course good food.
name: Sally

text: I love Thai food so i was excited to try this place out! I loved the atmosphere and was especially amazed by the live plant wall, perfect spot for a date or to dine with friends and although the kitchen closes at 10 the bar stays open until midnight. The Thai tea cocktail was delicious and i can't wait to go back and try some of the other cocktails available, there was one cocktail with onions that i think may be an acquired taste. The chili basil stir fry and coconut soup were really good and you can choose your own level of spicyness. The owner was super sweet and stopped by to chat with us briefly. Will definitely be back
name: Crystal

text: This place is incredible. Just overall great experience from the cocktails to the appetizers to the meal - as well as attentive service that was on point in all regards. The interior was designed really well (shoutout Flatland Kitchen) and they did a nice job at socially distancing each group as we dined. It's somewhat difficult to find as there is no visible sign outside but it's basically right across from the hardware store. They also have a lovely patio space that I will definitely be coming back to check out on a nicer + warmer day. It's quite small so I imagine it gets pretty busy on weekends. They don't take reservations but it's worth it to shoot your shot, you will not be disappointed!
name: Haley

text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! The vibe was right from the jump. The music was jammin' and the decor was earthy and made me feel like I wasn't in Indy. There is an outdoor seating area that was super cute, but we were too cold to enjoy it and opted to stay indoors. Our server was super funny and made us laugh the entire time. In fact, everyone at this restaurant was welcoming and super sweet. I ordered the chicken wings  as an appetizer which came with a side of sweet chili sauce. It would have been better if it was tossed in the sauce...but the wings were still good. For dinner, I ordered the mixed veg with chicken and white rice. Listen, the flavor from the chicken was perfect and mixed well with the rice. Everything we ordered was soooo good! I didn't even need to add soy sauce or ask for extra seasoning. I loved the rice so much that I had to try chicken fried rice too! By this time the kitchen had closed but the cooks whipped it up for me anyway...kudos to you!! I wouldn't change anything about my order and I def will be back to check out the other menu options at Bodhi!
name: Dinah

text: My husband and I went for a date night to Bodhi. They do not take reservations which honestly I feel is very essential during Covid especially that they were not seating at full capacity. We lucked out and were seated in a few minutes but right after us a wait started. I love Thai food so I was excited to try this new addition. It is in the place of where black market used to be. They did some changes in decor and it is an above 21 establishment. The menu has a great variety and is vegetarian friendly as are most Thai places. The bar area and music gave the place a nice vibe, but definitely is not a place to have dinner if you need quiet. The food is a little more pricier than other Thai restaurants. We enjoyed the papaya salad, it had tons of flavor. Spring rolls were good. I like the Tom Yum soup but my husband didn't as he thought it was very salty, we ordered it with tofu which was cut in very large pieces, I wish if they cut it smaller pieces. Chili shrimp was just ok, I was disappointed in that dish as I expected more flavor. Thai green curry with chicken was good but the curry was watered down in my opinion. Our waitress kept saying everything is good and it depends on what you're in a mood for which was not very helpful. I wish if she had explained the menu better. Otherwise she was attentive.
name: Lulu

text: Let me fully disclose that we met some long time friends for dinner and we had a great time visiting as well as enjoying the friendly service (great job Andrew B) and tasty food.  We had such a fun time that I am sure it puts a positive light on my rating and review.There are a few minor things to be aware of that would make for an even better experience.  First, if I hadn't known from other reviews that this bar bistro was in the former Black Market location, I might not have found it.  The building still says Black Market and I couldn't see anything about Bodhi until I went to the front door.  Another thing to note is that this location suffers from the lack of parking that every other business on Mass Ave has.  We got to the restaurant when it opened at 5 pm on Monday, but their tiny lot was almost full already (we got the last spot.)  I suppose we could have paid for metered parking somewhere along Mass Ave or parked at the parking garage at Bottleworks and walked over.  But be aware that if you are meeting someone, be sure you allot time to find parking.  Our friends arrived a few minutes ahead of us and were able to get a table for four by the windows.  (No reservations are available here.)  For us old folks, having lots of natural light to help read the menus is a plus.  They do have patio seating open but it felt a bit too chilly for us, so we stayed inside.  Our waiter was upbeat and eager to serve and stayed in a positive mood throughout the dinner and cocktails.  I was the only one of our party who was familiar with Thai cuisine, so we needed some time to pick.  We started with our beverages (I got the Emerald Buddha (fresh and crisp cocktail) to start.  They also have a nice lineup of local craft beers on hand.  coke products too.  They didn't have any ice tea made other than Thai tea, so my wife couldn't get an Arnold Palmer drink.  A little disappointed, but not a big deal.We moved on to some starters/shareables.  I ordered the Crab Puffs (think crab rangoon) which my wife declared she would get an order for herself next time and not share.  Served with sweet chili sauce for a sweet heat.  Probably the best rangoon we have had in town!  Highly recommended.  Our friend wanted a cup of Tom Yum soup, but was told it only was served in a large pot that was shareable.  I agreed to help her eat some.  Seems like minor change could be made to accommodate a single consumer.  The waiter said our friend could add a protein and make it her meal as an option, but enough of us agreed to help her eat it and we were brought out bowls and shared it.      My friends like spicy hot food, so I wasn't too concerned, but the website clearly states to not go too hot when ordering.  They can always add more spicy heat (they brought out chili flakes for our friends to add), but can't take it out.  If you order it hot and can't take it, too bad...no refunds on your mistake.  I like that they disclose this ahead of time and encourage people to not overdo the heat request until they are used to the standard heat levels served here.  Having said that, I ordered my items mildly spicy or at most, medium.  Our friends ordered their items medium and requested the pepper flakes, but didn't need many.  Be wise and aware of your options and responsibilities (you pay whether you eat it or not because of the heat level.)  I ordered my standard Pad See Ewe which I get at every Thai restaurant on my first visit so I have a point of comparison between restaurants.  This was delicious and though on the pricy end of the cost spectrum, there was plenty to get a take home box for a second meal.  I've tried making this at home and just the ingredients I purchased on my own make me wonder how a restaurant can charge as little as they do.  I really appreciate great flavor without having to do any of the work myself.  Thanks to the ladies who run the kitchen at Bodhi.  Excellent flavor!  Our friends and my wife ordered different entrees including various stir fry and the drunken noodles.  All reported they enjoyed their meals.  Everyone got take home boxes too.  If you leave her hungry, you must have shared everything or just didn't sample enough of what everyone else ordered!Because I finished my first cocktail while visiting and eating our appetizers, I ordered a tasty Francoise & Etienne cocktail to go with dinner.  It was so good I even ate the orchid and the tangerine ice cubes.  YumHopefully they can find a way to manage parking.  A new hardware store just opened a few weeks ago across the parking lot, so that is going to make parking even more challenging.  If you are young and healthy, I suggest street parking along Mass Ave if you spot a space.  I was hopeful there would be some handicap reserved spaces, but didn't see anything nearby.    I look forward to returning in the near future to try some of the other goodies on their menu and cocktail list.  Review #3904
name: Ken

text: Great ambience on their back patio with twinkle lights and a fire. Their service was quick and the food was delicious. If it's warm enough, highly suggest eating out there.
name: Catherine

text: Alex was our server and had awesome recommendations! My girlfriend and I were excited to try the new spot. We were impressed with the drinks, and the Crab Puffs were the best we've ever had! Perfect addition to Mass Ave. We'll be back. Often!
name: Eric

text: This place is absolutely phenomenal! We came in for some food and drinks and we let our server guide us through our time here. We told him what liquor we preferred to drink and he recommended cocktails that were absolutely amazing. The menu is full of amazing options, each perfectly cooked with excellent flavor balance. I will be back as soon as possible. This is a very welcome addition to Mass Ave. Can't wait for this patio when it's 10 degrees warmer!
name: Alayna

text: I was looking forward to 'Bodhi', every since I learned it was moving into the former 'Black Market' space.  I did call beforehand but they don't take reservations, it's first come, first served.  It would work even better, if they took reservations.  They are a 21 and over restaurant.  Also, they are closed on Tuesday(s).  It was a Friday night around 8ish, I put my name down on the waitlist but my table wasn't ready until 8:30 that night.  I return around that time and my table was ready.  Also, it still has the 'Black Market' sign on the side of the building.  They have a small parking lot, so parking is bit of a hassle.  The restaurant was almost full, it being a Friday night.For appetizers, I ordered from the 'Savory Bites''BODHI Spring Rolls'(POR PIA TOD | crunchy vegetables | glass noodles | sweet plum sauce)For the entree, 'Curries''Yellow Curry'(GAENG GARI SPAGHETTI | bone-in chicken or tofu | onion | spaghetti noodles)The 'Bodhi' Spring Rolls were filled with vegetables and noodles with a side of 'Sweet Plum' sauce for dipping.  The rolls were rather thin and could have been filled with more vegetables or noodles.The 'Yellow Curry' came out with two pieces of 'Bone-in Chicken' and topped with 'Onions'.  It was rather, a small portion.  The curry came with a side of 'Spaghetti Noodles', I didn't know how to eat noodles with a curry, so I ordered a side of 'Steamed Jasmine Rice'.  It was one the best curries, I have ever had!  It was spicy enough for me but it might be too spicy for someone who isn't Asian.  After I finished the rice, I dipped some of the noodles in the curry.
name: Fahad

text: Enjoyable Thai restaurant at far north end of Mass Ave. be prepared to WAIT for a table, ...but it's with it.  Creative and unique cocktails, followed by even tastier Thai food.  Appetizers were all tasty , and the Penang curry was amazing!  Outdoor seeing in summer provided a garden patio to diners , which felt like you were far from the downtown scene. Covered pergola, patio lights, fire pit, and vining music created a venue I would come back to.  Servers and owner were  all friendly and attentive .
name: Jam

text: Truly a lovely space. Gorgeous living wall as soon as you walk in. Every detail is thoughtful and beautiful. Dined in the patio area and it was great. Showed up about 15 minutes before the kitchen closed, but it wasn't an issue as we were seated immediately. Drunken Noodles - hands down best I've ever had. Emerald Buddha was my cocktail of choice, had to get a second. Our waitress was a rockstar. Every employee interaction was pleasant and kind. I rarely leave reviews, but this experience was incredible and I want BODHI to get their Yelp flowers.
name: Kendra

text: We went to Bodhi on a Tuesday night after reading many reviews, and finally seeing that they had dine in seating available. All I can say is it was nothing short of delicious. I had the pad see ewe. She had the cashew stir fry. Both amazing. Cocktails on point as well. Service was exemplary. Definitely check this new Thai place out, you won't regret it!
name: Jesse

text: Tried this place with my fiancé last night. The wait did not take too long (hostess said 30min, but it was more like 15) and we sat outside on their nice patio.I tried the stir fried flat noodles and my fiancé had the roasted chili shrimp stir fry- both rated "mild" on the menu and I asked the waiter if he could make sure mine was more on the mild side. I'm not sure if there was a mix up, but my dish was nearly inedible from how spicy it was! Luckily my fiancé prefers spicy food and we were able to switch meals (which is perplexing as they were rated the same level of hot and his was fine).We let the waiter know, and he and another person offered to make us the same dish, which was considerate (we declined). I think we'll give it another chance in the future, but definitely a little wary given the wide range of mild between two dishes rated the same, which is disappointing considering the price point.
name: Katie

text: I was torn on how many stars to give this review and decided it was a toss up between a 2+ and 3- because treating people rudely when they don't deserve it is never "ok" in my book...on to my review.     A foodie friend who periodically organizes dinners out at various restaurants heard about Bodhi and, after reading the excellent reviews, arranged for a group of us to visit on April 7, 2021 for drinks and dinner. Since no reservations are taken upon her arrival my friend advised the hostess that we were a party of 10 and being familiar with Covid restrictions she told the hostess we were more than willing to split up and maintain social distancing guidelines so we could be seated in the restaurant as it was early evening and a bit chilly out on the patio. (At that point, the restaurant was virtually empty.) Her request was denied and actually my friend was treated rudely enough by the hostess that when I pulled up, she was getting into her vehicle and driving away.     She explained later that the hostess insisted that if our group wanted to sit together we would have to be seated on the patio at one of their larger tables. When I arrived, I was led to our table by the hostess who greeted me pleasantly.  Knowing we were going to be more than 6 I was confused by the seating arrangements because there was a different party of two at the end of that table and with the 6' between parties rule most of the table had to remain empty (expecting 10 and only room for 6). It made no sense for the hostess to have seated us there when there was a second large table right behind us that was empty of diners!!! Seems the hostess was more comfortable causing our party difficulties than ensuring we had a nice dining experience.      Everyone in our party witnessed the hostile attitude of the hostess because one of us arrived when she had apparently left the stand and finding nobody there, he came in, found us and sat down next to me (unfortunately for him in the "forbidden zone") and we started talking. Having been alerted an additional member of our group arrived, she hustled out there and rather than apologizing for the seating confusion and offering to move us to the larger table she chastised him at length over Covid restrictions. So, our party of 10 had now been pared down to 7 and that was only because we suggested moving the 7th person to the head of our table.      Having worked in customer service for many years this is not how you treat people if you want them to patronize your establishment. No one in our group appreciated this type of treatment. No, we were not arguing about Covid restrictions - our problem was with YOU insisting we sit on the patio then HASSLING us for sitting at the table YOU put us at after being told the size of our party and failing to simply move us to an empty, available table to maintain social distancing from another party...pretty simple solution, right?     The upside to our Bodhi dining experience is those that got their dishes made the way they ordered them had positive things to say. Personally, I had ordered the Chili & Basil stir fry mild and asked for some of the peppers to spice the dish to my liking which never made it to the table and it took real persistence on my part to get some to go so I could appropriately spice the dish at home. The crab puffs were crispy like normal crab rangoon, but the filling was extra creamy and delicious. The fruit salad dessert was tasty with a custard like bottom layer. The chef described how it was made when it was delivered to the table. It was clear that she really cared about the food she was preparing and that people unfamiliar with some of the ingredients used in Thai cooking were educated about them.     There were some issues with the spice levels of a couple of the dishes. One diner ordered the Chili & Basil stir fry at the 3-heat level, but her dish arrived mild and she was disappointed it was "bland". There was also an issue with the Sweet and Sour Chicken dish that was ordered mild (with some additional modifications) and ended up being so spicy she couldn't eat it. Although the dish was remade the replacement included the green peppers she originally requested be left out. She ate it anyway because her appetizer had been forgotten and she had to be very insistent with our waiter to get it delivered out to the table.     Apparently they are still working out the kinks on everything from where to seat people, how to get food out to diners at the same time (or at least close to the same time) and how to turn over tables quickly - we waited 15 minutes on our checks after we requested them, then had to flag down our waiter (who was less than attentive to our party - don't know whether they were understaffed that evening or what) to get them and had to tell him what we ordered because he "didn't remember who ordered what" which was a bad way to end the evening as it wasn't exactly sitting out on the patio weather to begin with.
name: Cynthia

text: This place is so so SO good. I already can't wait to go back. My gf got Panang Curry and was very impressed. We also ordered the crab puffs. Our cocktails were amazing as well.
name: Shea

text: Bodhi has some of the best presentation of their food and drinks that I've seen. Their cocktail list is extensive and there's a lot of ingredients I wasn't familiar with, but our server was happy to answer any questions. We dined in their outdoor area, which is pretty large and makes you want to spend hours out there sipping cocktails and conversing with friends. The food was good, but we thought it wasn't very spicy (even when it was ordered as "hot"). We've been spoiled with some really good Thai restaurants in our hood and felt that Bodhi wasn't quite as great. But I would definitely return because everything we ate and drank was good.
name: Laura

text: Great place for a first date type of situation wanting fancy cute craft cocktails and nice ambience, not for hungry couples that just want good food and decent portions and don't really care for all that . Food was just ok , not bad but wasn't good enough for us to return . Portion size weren't the best and price for the portion was not worth it in my personal opinion .when I think of Thai food , I want good portion , price.
name: Ang

text: I will blissfully be back to Bodhi. See what I did there? We decided on Bodhi to celebrate a friend's birthday and I am so glad we did. Parking is getting a bit tricky on Mass Ave but we found a paid street parking spot a couple of blocks away. Good vibes only at Bodhi! It feels light and airy yet welcoming and cozy. I love a brick interior. We were fascinated and super impressed by the plant wall. How do they keep all those beauties looking so fresh? Magic. Speaking of magic...get the crab puffs. They are so delicious that we got a second order. They put all other crab Rangoon to shame. You'll never look at a takeout rangoon the same again. Seriously. They were crispy and the crab was fresh. Just get them and you'll see. We also shared the spring rolls and the lemon grass soup with tofu. The lemongrass soup tasted like it had been cooking all day. Just delicious. For an entrée (yes, we had to try all the things!) we got the green curry with chicken. A++. We clearly didn't have any room for the ice cream with rice but next time, next time.
name: Claire

text: Great ambiance and vibe for a Friday night dinner. They serve a selection of Asian and Thai entrees, like Pad Thai and curries. Our food took nearly 50 minutes to come to the table; our waitress had mentioned the kitchen was slightly backed up that night. Their cocktail list is amazing. For the price point of nearly $18 an entree, it's on the pricier end of what is typical for Thai food in Indianapolis. But the environment and experience make up for it.
name: Christine

text: This place has been on my list for awhile, finally got the chance to visit last night and I'm glad I did! When you arrive you can put your name in and they will text you once your seat is ready.There is a great selection of cocktails, I had the emerald Buddha and the gin and tonic. Both were delicious and refreshing.For food we had shrimp cocktail with this awesome spicy green dipping sauce and spring rolls with a plum sauce.My main course was drunken flat noodles with shrimp and they were delicious flavorful, and I was given the option on heat level started with the medium hot and there were extra flakes to add if needed.The service is awesome! Very attentive and personableZPlace everyone should check out, I can't wait to go back and they have what looks like an awesome outdoor space so I'll be interested to check out that space as well!
name: Sarah

text: Very fresh ingredients, great ambiance, friendly service, and great menu offerings making this place seem like an up and coming top new Thai destination. Complete wine and cocktail list. Only gripe was that portion sizes were not consistent -- curry dish and spicy shrimp dish were much smaller and barely shareable compared to the pad see ewe.
name: Peter

text: Unequivocally the finest Asian dining in Indianapolis. Authentic Thai cuisine, nestled in the (gorgeous) old Black Market, with amazing service! After a dozen+ trips here, officially my new favorite restaurant in Indiana. Pro-Tip: No reservations so come early or drop your name an hour before you plan to eat & go chill at Pins till they text you (they text you a link to monitor wait time).Amazing Food... The proprietor's mother runs the kitchen, and she runs a tight ship. You can peep in and watch the magic happen. I've lived in Asia / backpacked a decent chunk of my mother-continent, and can honestly everything here is very authentic. I usually start with the Fired Tofu for my starter, its got a perfect crisp & the peanut sauce isn't too sweet. For entrees, if you only order one... ORDER DRUNKEN NOODLES! The texture of the drunken noodles aka pad kee mao are incredible here, perfectly chewy but doesn't stick to your teeth. The flavors are very nice, solid blend of sweetness & spice (I advise mild heat). The curries are all very well executed but I default to the Massaman + Naan. Not spicy and has a very intense flavor profile for peanut lovers. The super tender carrots and potatoes really soak in the flavor.Amazing Service... The wait staff here is all phenomenal, I have yet to have a bad experience even with large groups! I have had a group of 8, taking over the booths on the right with no drop off in service quality. The owner "leads from the front", constantly on her feet and you'll often see her clearing tables too, can't say enough how smooth the front of house is run!Awesome Value... You're only spending about 50% more here per plate than you would in a run down strip mall on Lafayette Road and you're getting fresh ingredients prepared in a much more refined kitchen. With all the entrees under $20, this place is an absolute bargain. The portion sizes are generous but I advise over-ordering, most of the food reheats very well.
name: Roger

text: I've been to bodhi twice now and enjoyed each time. Great food and drinks, fresh ingredients and with a beautiful atmosphere. The service has been excellent, with the servers providing great insight on dishes and drinks!
name: Valarie

text: Decided to try takeout after hearing about this place. So I went with the "popular/recommend" dishes that pop up.... I got spring rolls, green curry (chicken/spicy), massaman curry (braised beef/medium), and pad Thai (chicken/medium). Everything was good! The only negative, would be that the beef curry dish, had much less meat in it than the other two. *Also worth a note, their parking lot is an issue. During peak times would be worth remaining parked elsewhere in the area, to dine in or grab takeout.
name: Nicole

text: Love the drunken noodles (huge portion!) and the masaman curry. The potatoes and carrots served with naan make this the ultimate comfort food. The patio is gorgeous but you'll want a spot under the trellis as it can get hot in the sun. Easy to park by bottleworks district, they don't take reservations so put your name in and go grab a drink nearby and wait for the call, it's worth it!
name: Allyson

text: This place is still pretty new but you'd never know it! The servers are on it, helpful with recommendations and very friendly. Food was very good, particularly the pork skewer appetizer and the crab puff appetizer! Also very much enjoyed my drink. Wish they offered a few more "small plate" type options, only choices really were full entrees or appetizers, and sometimes I just want something lighter. But all and all a great place. We'll be back!
name: Sam

text: I had a jasmine spritz cocktail with the crab puffs and drunken noodles with shrimp- all 3 were delicious. The restaurant was beautiful and great service. Will definitely return!
name: Monica

text: If you are a vegetarian then this is not the place for you as all curries , soups and some salads have fish  base or chicken stocks and they will not make any thing without it. So I ended up with stir fried noodles in  Thai restaurant . Fried veg egg rolls were good. Can not say that it was an authentic thai restaurant.
name: Ruta

text: This was such a cute little hidden gem in the Bottleworks district! While waiting for our table outside we were able to order drinks and sit in the front which we loved. Outside seating is very chill and so beautiful! Food was delicious, I got the cashew stir fry & it paired well with the fruity drink I had (can't remember the name) & our server was wonderful. Will be coming back.
name: Cassie

text: This place was amazing. Great food, great atmosphere, and great service. We got the drunken noodles and masaman curry. Both were delicious. And if you're debating about getting the crab puffs: DO IT. Best crab puffs I've ever had. Overall a great experience. I will definitely be back.
name: Lindsey

text: SO GOOD. I got the coconut soup and crab puffs which were both 10/10! The interior is super cute and fun. The waiter was very helpful in giving us advice when we couldn't choose between dishes (because they all looked so good). I'm excited to try out the outdoor patio once it gets warm. Note -- parking is rough. Not a lot space. Best bet is to park at botttleworks. Maybe the restaurant would consider reimbursement? Also the outdoor patio is not dog friendly :(
name: Natalie

text: Bodhi is absolutely amazing and I can't wait to go back! Service was great and quick. The atmosphere is so cool and cute for a date night or fun place to take friends. All of the food came to the table with steam coming off of it which is always a good sign! My friend at the table said that her and her husband had been to Bodhi three times in the last month. So I knew it must be good, but I could not have expected how delicious it would be! I think for the first few minutes after our table was served no one said anything besides for wow! Every single bite was so flavorful. Needless to say, everyone loved the food that they ordered and most of us had leftovers too! Our table ordered: 2 Pad Thais with Chicken, Drunken Noodles with Shrimp & Chicken Skewers with Naan Bread. The drinks were great too! The first drink I ordered was the Buddha drink which was good, but my favorite drink was the Étienne drink. The Étienne included champagne, a few other liquors and ingredients and clementine ice cubes! I also tried a sip of the Alcoholic Thai Iced tea and oh my goodness, such a delicious combination of different spices! There is also outdoor seating with fire pits too!
name: Regan

text: I've been wanting to try this place for quite a while and it did not disappoint! We got there early to be sure we got a table (I've tried to go before and the wait time was too long for my hunger situation). The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the many drink offerings they had. I started with the Pisces to Aries which was sweet and had a really nice lychee flavor. We shared the spring rolls which were amazing. They were so flavorful and had the best crispy outside. We were told they're rolled by the owners grandmother everyday! For dinner I had the yellow curry with rice instead of noodles. Y'all! This chicken was amazing! It just fell off the bone and the curry sauce was the perfect pairing. It was not too spicy but had enough to balance the sweetness of the carrots. The waiter said this was his favorite dish.
name: Claire

text: Treated myself for my birthday and went for a solo date. Best idea ever!It's a first come first serve place as they don't take reservations. It took a bit for the hostess to acknowledge me, but it wasn't too bad.I was seated in the patio and it is lovely especially during a 80 degree evening in Indy. My server was attentive but not imposing which I appreciate.My drink was absolutely delicious, I ordered a second one. My food was also very good.Definitely looking forward to going back!
name: Miriam

text: This place has a really cool atmosphere and their outdoor seating makes you feel like you aren't downtown Indy. I've had Thaitanium and Siam Square, but this was way higher quality. Their tofu appetizer was awesome and we split it as a group. I would totally order again and I normally don't ever order tofu. Spring rolls were very fresh. I also got their Massaman Curry, which was mouth watering. My husband got the Pad Thai, which was the best Pad Thai I've had in Indy. The helpings were huge too, so we ended up taking leftovers home. Lots of fun seasonal drinks as well.
name: Anne

text: I had a solid, but not outstanding, first experience at Bodhi when we dined in for dinner a few weeks back. I'll start with the food, which was good but not great - especially in comparison to other popular local Thai spots like Siam Square, Thaitanium, etc. We preferred the spring rolls to start, which came out crazy fast (like 3-4 minutes after we ordered) but lacked a ton of great flavor. My entree was the drunken noodles, a typically reliable favorite for me to try at new Thai restaurants, but I was very disappointed. It also lacked much flavor, and the ratio/construct of the dish was off to me - it was VERY vegetable heavy (over half the plate was veggies). The noticeable lack of noodles and protein (chicken) had it tasting more like a veggie stir fry with a few noodles and a couple pieces of chicken added, than an actual noodle dish. I'll also point out that the service we received was not very welcoming or friendly, even when we identified ourselves as first time customers. The gentleman (I can't remember his name, but he was wearing hipster-esque sunglasses inside) serving us was standoffish and cold. I'm not sure if that was an intentional vibe he was trying to put off; if so, he successfully made us feel like we were an unwanted part of his job. Where Bodhi excels (and boosts itself from a 3 star ranking to a 4) is the cocktails and atmosphere. There are a number of great drink options, unlike the other local Thai options, and the space itself is very cool. I wish we would've had a chance to sit outside as that patio looked awesome on a cool summer evening. If you're more looking for a cool spot to sit outside and have drinks with Thai menu options, Bodhi is your spot. If you're looking for a high quality Thai meal (no drinks) or a great takeout choice, I would look elsewhere. I might be back.
name: Drew

text: We stopped by Bodhi on a random Tuesday evening to try a new place in downtown Indy. There was almost no wait as the hostess sat us in the private garden patio. To our pleasant surprise, it was an appetizer only night because the kitchen was closed to provide their staff with much needed time off (can't applaud them enough for that!)The crab puffs were delightful. I ordered a drink that seemed to be a Thai spin on a French 75. Can't wait to go back and try the full menu!
name: Hayden

text: Great dining experience. I came on Easter and decided to call to make sure they were open. The host was very polite over the phone and when I came in. The server was exceptional. He gave great cocktail and appetizer recommendations. My food was delicious, light and beautiful.
name: Nadia

text: In the quest for finding the best thai food, I decided to try Bodhi! I got the drunken noodles and they were pretty decent. I wish it had a better spice to it but nothing a spice tray can't fix. The tofu itself was also pretty good in the dish. I also really like their rotating drinks that they bring in. Overall, I think their drinks are key. The atmosphere here is awesome as well. Whether you are inside or outside, good vibes all around. I will say I sat outside in the direct sun and definitely was sweating. Overall, I love this place for drinks, but potentially can work on the Thai food. Would love to see a little bit more well spiced dishes in the future.
name: Vraj

text: This is my new favorite place in Indy right now. Great cocktails, different from other places I've been to around here. Fantastic Thai food. Nice restaurant space and outdoor patio. I've been three times and had good service every time.My only suggestion is to turn the music down a notch or two. It was loud enough to be distracting at times when I was there. Maybe I'm getting old.
name: A

text: Uhhh hi, Bodi! Welcome to Indy. I love you! Great food. Great service. It's the perfect location for date night or out with your friends. I was really impressed with the menu and hotness levels.
name: Stephanie

text: We loved our food and overall experience! For drinks we got the Françoise & Étienne and Seven Realms of Happiness (both were great!). For appetizers, we asked to split the coconut soup which was amazing. We also ordered spring rolls, but these were not as impressive as the rest of the food. For the main dish, I got the Massaman Curry with naan and jasmine rice -  very delicious! We topped it all off with their seasonal ice cream. Can't wait to come back!
name: Hannah

text: Fantastic food, fantastic drinks, great atmosphere. 10/10 ! We were also told by our very kind waiter that the restaurant owner is originally from Bangkok and the restaurant is operated by 3 generations of that family, so cool!  We'll be eating here as often as we can!
name: Becca

text: Truly a unique and delicious place!  By far the best panang curry I've ever had. Cocktails were creative and delightful.  Service was perfect and the environment was hip and cozy. Will definitely be back!
name: Jessica

text: Wonderful drinks!  Wonderful food!  I love what they transformed the place into. It was sad to see Black Market close, but I love the refresh and the team knows what they are doing behind the bar and in the kitchen!  Highly recommend this great downtown spot!
name: John

text: My husband and I are staying at Bottleworks for a short staycation. I wanted to go somewhere close by for dinner, and we stumbled upon Bodhi. The wait for a table on a Friday evening was 30-45 minutes - not bad. But the bar was open and available - yay! So we sat and had the most surprisingly wonderful cocktails. I have to say, the Francois and Etienne was AMAZING, and I don't usually enjoy gin. For dinner, we shared the spring rolls and pork skewers. I would buy the peanut sauce (from the pork skewers) in a bowl, it was fantastic. My husband got the pad Thai extra spicy () and I got the cashew stir fry with chicken (mild). Let's just say I could taste the flavors in mine, and it was absolutely delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant, even if you are not familiar with Thai food. Everything is amazing!
name: Jessica

text: This time was much better than last time. Last time they were still figuring things out and in their opening stages. The drinks are ok. They are pricey, crafty, and not that great. The food however was good. They were out of the crab puffs I wanted. They had sold out an hour prior. It was pretty late when we got there. The kitchen was about to close. Oh the kitchen closes at 9 when the restaurant closes at 10. We both ordered the same spice level on our food but somehow mine was spicier. I think because I got noodles and he got panang curry.  The rice cuts the spice some. The flavors of these two dishes were great. Our server and service was pretty nice as well. Good vibes. Will def go back.
name: Sana

text: Thai is the way to my heart & I'm already ready to go back!  Bodhi is a Thai bistro & craft bar located on Mass Ave in Indianapolis. The food and service was incredible!
name: Olivia

text: This place is the swankiest Thai restaurant in town. Great drinks/ambiance. The rangoons are great-really their appetizers are all amazing. The main dishes are great too-as with every Thai restaurant I get the mixed veggie dish with chicken-Thai hot. Not quite as spicy as I like but good.
name: Johnny

text: This place is truly a hidden gem on Mass Ave! The food was great and the drinks were outstanding! They have a ton of great and unique cocktails. I had a drink I think was called Hide Your Ponytail. All I know is I slurped two of them down real quick! The food was excellent as well. We loved the crab Rangoon and I had the Pad See Yoo. The portions are very generous and I walked away stuffed. Our waitress was super friendly and attentive. If you love Thai food or good drinks, I highly recommend stopping by Bodhi.
name: Carly

text: Still obsessing over this place. Truly to die for food and cocktails with a stunning ambiance. We were lucky enough to snag a patio seat with the walls covered in greenery. The wait staff was so attentive and great, which is hard to come by nowadays. Each cocktail the recommended got better and better. (All were great) we started with the spring rolls which didn't last long at all. My fiancé got the Thai beef salad and I got the pad see ewe noodles with pork. We couldn't stop eating even after we were stuffed. I'm so glad this place is a new edition to Indianapolis. We already made dinner plans with friends to come back.
name: Alex

text: Bodhi has replaced Black Market and the Black Market sign is even still on the building. If you'd ever been to Black Market, you know the space is very small and intimate and that fact has not change. Actually, the place pretty much looks the same except for a few minor decor changes like a greenery wall with neon signage and light up Bodhi letters. The Bodhi website says they don't take reservations, so I was a bit confused when we arrived on a Friday night, saw multiple empty tables, but were told there was an hour wait (maybe they were waiting for parties to walk back over). Despite the hour wait, we put our name on the waitlist and went for a drink nearby. After about 45 minutes we received a text saying our table was ready and headed back over. The hostess and our waiter were both very pleasant, our food came quickly and everything was tasty. I'd say the appetizers were the best part. The Drunken Noodles were good and on par with many others I've had and enjoyed, but I'm not going to say they were anything special. There are many options on the menu and I look forward to returning to try another noodle dish and/or a curry option and a cocktail.
name: Antonia

text: Bodhi has the best food, vibes, and aesthetic. I brought my mom here while she was visiting because it is my favorite Thai place downtown. We got the special for $7 spring rolls which were crispy and delicious! I would recommend this place to anyone who likes Thai food, they've got the spice if you want it!  Also very impressed with the real plant wall as well, the waitress was telling me about the built in irrigation system. Immaculate vibes.
name: Kathleen

text: Get there early! Checked out this excellent new Thai spot on Saturday, and got there right at opening. Within 15-20min the whole place was full. It was full for good reason! We ordered the crispy tofu appetizer, and two seasonal cocktails. Then shared the pad see ew, and green curry. It was spicy and fresh, everything was so flavorful. The service was great and we had so much food to share! Really loved everything, and would love to go back soon. 21 and over only- so it's a date night spot. No complaints here!
name: Emma

text: Best Thai in Indy - hands down! Awesome food and ambiance along with great drinks. Would 100/100 recommend.
name: Christopher

text: Bodhi is absolutely phenomenal! Mass Ave needed this Thai Bistro. Nestled at the very end of Mass Ave - this spot is far enough from the busiest part of the strip that when you sit in their outdoor space, it does not feel like you're sitting on one of the busiest streets downtown. We came on a Friday evening and were promptly seated outside! The outdoor space is cozy and warm with twinkly lights, a fire pit, and sofa chairs. Upon receiving our menus, we noticed they had both an extensive drink and food menu. With it being our first time here, we let our server Alex guide us on which specialty cocktails to go for. We ended up with the seasonal cocktails: Kinnaree and Seven Realms of Happiness. Both were so good we got a second round! The flavors and ingredients tasted so fresh and really meshed together. Very refreshing drinks to have on a warm Spring day sitting in the sun! For the food, we got an order of crab puffs. Then ordered the Shrimp Drunken Noodles and Chicken Panang Curry. My favorite crab puff used to be at a different restaurant, but since having the crab puff at Bodhi, I have a new favorite! Again, it has everything to do with how flavorful and fresh the food tastes. Their crab puffs are stuffed perfectly and crisped to perfection. Next, our entrees came out piping hot and were the perfect spice level. Personally, I think this is the best curry I have ever had in downtown Indy. We did not get dessert but we will definitely be getting some the next time we are in. The final big compliment I have is for the staff. Everyone is so kind and welcoming. You can tell by the way the staff interacts with the customers and by how amazing everything (from the cocktails to apps to entrees) that they truly care about their craft! Our server Alex was so helpful, and we loved that he just let us relax and enjoy our time. Bodhi came to me highly recommended, and I am passing on that sentiment - go, you will not regret it! This very well may be the best Thai in Indy!
name: Adrienne

text: This place used to be black market. The atmosphere and esthetic is still the same. I arrived early as all indications were there would be a wait. Luckily, there was no wait and I was seated right away. The cocktail list is nice, featuring cocktails with an Asian theme. The spring rolls were average. The crab puffs again were average. The main dishes, pad thai, and roasted chili shrimp stir fry, were good, but not sure they were worth the premium. I have had better food at a local Thai takeout. The service was fast, our server was very nice.
name: John

text: I went to BODHI two times in one day and it was even more amazing the second time!! The cocktails were so fun and so tasty, the apps were so unique and INCREDIBLE. Dinner came out so quick and was perfectly cooked. Also the service was awesome, I wish I remembered our servers name he was so kind and excited to tell us all about his faves on the menu. I am so super excited that BODHI has came to Indy and I feel so happy and proud to see indy reopening with lots of new places to eat and drink. Welcome to the fam BODHI, I already love you dearly.
name: Denae

text: Pretty good. The food was good. I felt like they should give eating plates along with the serving dishes that the food is on. I was kind of confused as to weather it was just meant for us to eat off the dishes the food was served on or not. One dish was quite large or one portion & the other dish was a salad & served in on a tall dish that was quite awkward to eat from. We also had an appetizer that we shared & had to ask for plates for it. We sat at the plant wall at the front of the restaurant, which is beautiful but the plants hung down kind of low & tickled my hair the whole time. The  atmosphere is nice. Service was okay, they were busy, so, it was fine, not overly attentive, but friendly.  I was really disappointed that they had no non-alcoholic mocktails on their menu.
name: Lori

text: Best Thai I've had in Indy, one of my favorite restaurants in general! Delicious and authentic food with knowledgeable staff. Fun and creative drink menu. Good option for a date or any occasion. :)
name: Meg

text: I went to Bodhi on Wednesday for the first time. We had a 90 minute wait but plenty of places nearby to grab a drink so no problem. We were notified we had a table right at 90 minutes. When we were seated our server alex quickly greeted us and apologized for the wait - he and the bartender were the only two on the floor that night. Our service was great and I wouldn't have noticed he was running the floor solo if he hadn't told us! His recommendations for drink and food were delicious and he was very attentive. Generous portions. I'll be back!
name: Haley

text: Absolutely fantastic vibes and fantastic food. We had the wings and tofu for an appetizer and both were fantastic. The entrees were pretty spicy but if you can handle it they're great. The drinks are the real seller. I had the Françoise and it was so good. Our waiter Alex was fantastic. We never waited for anything and he had great recommendations. All around a great experience and I highly recommend this place for those who love good food and greater vibes
name: Hannah

text: Finally tried Bodhi! The ambiance and vibe of the place is fantastic for a date night, girls night out, etc. An Instagram worthy spot. Great service. The food had a lot of flavor and SPICE! The drunken noodles were saucy and delicious. We will be back!
name: Meghan

text: The outdoor seating was closed due to rain so the wait was rather long. HOWEVER, the food and cocktails were worth the wait. The vibe of the restaurant was comforting and so was our meals. Be prepared for left overs or plan to share because the portions are generous.
name: Lindsay

text: The driver told me it was her first day and she didn't want to do it alone, so her friend was driving. She apologized for the delay. I told her she was 20 minutes ahead of schedule. She was very kind and so was her friend. The food was delicious. I wish I could give her more than 5 stars!
name: Brandon

text: Bodhi: in Buddhism, the state of enlightenment. ...and also the new Thai restaurant and craft cocktail bar on Mass Ave. Located in the former Black Market space, this new gem serves up the freshest Thai food in the most inviting space - just peep that living wall! Three generations of women own the restaurant and have a team of all women chefs! I got to meet the owner Carmine and her mom while picking up takeout. They were so welcoming and you could tell they put so much love into everything they create. They're opened for carry out only for now and hope to be opened to the public by March 25. We got the spring rolls, sweet and sour stir fry with tofu, and stir fried flat noddles (pad see ewe) with tofu. Everything was so fresh and delicious. I look forward to trying more when they open!
name: Erin

text: I came here for a birthday dinner and was very impressed with the food. Nice large portions and good quality. I always get pad Thai and this was some of the best around! Only reason for the star deduction is I wasn't a fan of my cocktail. Next time I will come back and try something different though for sure!
name: Taylor

text: I can't praise this restaurant enough. From the engaging staff to the outdoor surroundings, the vibe is outstanding. We started with the pork skewers. Tender and juicy with great flavors with a wonderful peanut sauce. I had the cashew stir fry with tofu  Thai hot. They are not shy on spice. The flavors are bright and spice level is evident. Really delicious. Their drink menu is great. Try the Kha Mule. This will be a regular stop for me.
name: Christopher

text: Food is excellent, but their service is severely lacking. First time we were turned away when the hours on Google say until 11:00. We got there at 9:30 and were told kitchen closes at 10:00 and they couldn't serve us. Next time we showed up pretty early and they told us they didn't have any seating for us. Finally, after I told them it was our anniversary, they gave us a tiny table outside but warned it was going to rain. It did start raining at the end of the meal, but at least we got to eat. As I said, the food was excellent. For this reason, we've gotten to-go twice because we didn't want to hassle with being told we couldn't be seated again. Tonight we called to order to-go again and we are told they're not doing to-go orders tonight due to being a little short-staffed. We only wanted to order one order of fried rice, but we had to end up settling for the Thai restaurant on the south side which isn't anywhere near as good. I'm not sure how long they'll stay in business at Bodhi with their lack of seating and not even having to-go available. If these things were improved on, it would be a 5-star review!
name: Julie

text: I would give this place zero stars if I could. We walked in at 8:40 pm and was told the kitchen closed at 10, so we might not be able to eat.  We said we were fine to wait and see. We were handed a cocktail menu.  When we asked if we could order a drink while we waited for a table, the hostess said she was doing the best she could to get us to eat. The hostess then said it would be about 20 minutes before we had a table so we should be okay to order food.  My husband joked and said he would hope so 'cause that would give the kitchen 40 minutes to cook.  He was not rude at all.  He even giggled when he said it. The hostess had obviously had a bad day or was just a mean little person because she asked us to leave and took the menu away.  We were befuddled and definitely think they go beyond giving pretentious a bad name. Spend your money where it's appreciated and nice people are hired. I'm embarrassed that Indy would be so rude to people.  Sad day on Mass Ave.
name: Amanda

text: Great experience at Bodhi last night. It's a very busy and popular place so expect a wait. We were starved so we started with the crab puffs. There were 7 very full crab puffs! The sauce it came with was made from scratch and had a little bit of extra heat that paired perfectly with the sweet puffs. I ordered the Bloom to Bloom drink after I read the story behind it. The cool presentation was a bonus! I got the massaman curry which is not my typical order at a Thai place but it came highly recommended. It was perfect! It comes with naan instead of rice. Perfect sop up the delicious curry. It's very hearty and would be good in winter with the braised beef. My husband usually gets red curry but they do not have that type. He got the panang curry which was missing the usual red chili heat. It still got the job done. Can't wait to go back!
name: Laurel

text: I love this place! Their cocktails are amazing. Their bar and signs are so cute. The staff is so nice. The chicken wings are a must. And the drunken noodles were my favorite.
name: Sable

text: Food and drinks are very good here!  Would definitely recommend.  The noodles are made in house, so they are incredible.  I've taken out of town visitors here and they are always very impressed with Bodhi.
name: Samantha

text: Okay this place is IT. If you're looking for the best Thai food, look no further. Now you might have to look a little further than you think only because it's tucked away with no signs outside.We came about 6:00 on a Saturday night, and only had to wait 30 minutes. Just enough time to walk around and see the Bottleworks district. Chicken skewers were fantastic and had an incredible peanut sauce. We ordered some naan bread to dip into the extra peanut sauce. SO good. The chicken panang curry was so flavorful and is the best I've had. Service was top notch as well. I couldn't recommend this place any more!
name: Anna

text: What a cute little spot at the tip of mass ave!! This place is perfect for a dinner with friends or little date night. They have an outdoor space that's so well done but truly the inside is just as cute. As some people would say "Instagram worthy."Bow onto the food - HUGE portions! You could definitely split any of the entres. I love pad Thai and their pad Thai is one of the best I've had in Indy. I got medium heat, I feel like I could have gone all the way since pad Thai sauce usually calms the heat. Appetizers deforest the fried tofu and absolutely the crab Rangoon (some of the best).They have a huge list of beers and crafty cocktails. You can order pretty much whatever drink your heart desires.Enjoy :)
name: Dani

text: It was so good! Service was a little slow, but it was a Friday night and busy- so as to be expected. The drinks, apps and entrees were all hot and fantastic!! Full of flavor and exactly what you're looking for in a Thai dish! Loved the vibe. Check it out!
name: Chelsea

text: At the end of Mass Ave, Bodhi sits in the brick building. I hope they work on a sign for the side of the building, but the door has the business name so you know you are in the right place. We went on a Monday night for a birthday dinner, and wow this place was busy! There is proper spacing inside, but we came in at the right time as after us there was a good wait.Savory Bites: We started off with the Crab Puffs, which are equivalent to crab rangoons. That sweet chili sauce is amaaaazing.Drinks: I got the Thai Iced Tea which hit the spot. They also have a cocktail version that intrigues me, will try next time. My boyfriend got a cocktail - and apologies, I can't remember the name and the cocktail menu is not online. It was basically a boozy lemon lime soda, tasty. They were quite backed up at the bar and we didn't get our drinks until after our Crab Puffs were finished. It seemed like everyone came at once and I can't fault the bartender for that, but perhaps someone needs to be cross trained to jump in.Entrees: Each entree has a RECOMMENDED spice rating, you still get to pick the spiciness level unless there is a * which means mild is not available. I got the Green Curry which was borderline too spicy for me personally at the Medium level. It wasn't my favorite green curry I've had, but that doesn't mean I didn't enjoy it. I loved the plating for it! My boyfriend got the Pad Thai and it was delicious.It definitely seems like the new hot spot. Will be looking to circle back at some point and try some of their noodle dishes, and one of those craft cocktails!
name: Brittany

text: Came here and got cocktails and dessert. Their cocktails are amazing! Highly recommend. The desserts are okay... they are from gallery pastry bar. I hear the main food is amazing tho and can't wait to come back and try it.
name: Sable

text: If I were rich and could hire a personal assistant, I'd hire our waiter, Alex. He was fantastic from the start with recommendations and checking on us frequently. I've never ever sent anything back before, but when I ordered a cocktail that I truly did not like, he was wonderful and swapped it out for me.  The only bad thing was the mezcal cocktail which three people at my table did not like at all (it was extra smoky, in a sort of artificial way). Everything else was fantastic! The other two cocktails were delicious, especially the Seven Realms of Heaven. I ordered the Tom Yum soup because I've heard it's an extremely popular Thai dish, and it was delicious and served in a beautiful bowl. The crab wontons we're also great and way more flavorful than the kind you'd order at a cheap Chinese restaurant. Overall I would definitely return here.
name: Macaira

text: This little gem is at the end of Mass Ave. Unfortunately, they do not take reservations and the restaurant is small, so be prepared for a wait. Luckily, my husband and I went as a party of 2 so we were able to get seated at the bar relatively quickly (~20 min wait). Nonetheless, I do feel it is worth the wait. It's a very cute and small restaurant that serves nice sized portions and great drinks. As an appetizer, we ordered the crab puffs which are crab rangoon. They were decent but nothing special..not sure if I would order them again. For the entree, my  husband and I ordered the drunken noodle to share. When asked how spicy I told them medium but I believe they made them hot instead. I have a pretty good tolerance for spicy foods, but my husband couldn't tolerate it at all. For those who have a lower tolerance for spicy foods, beware and maybe stick with the mild (or no heat if that's an option), just in case. Aside from that mixup, the dish was great. The flavor of the noodles with the chicken added in were delicious.  My husband had to order a second dish to eat and ended up getting Pad Thai...he absolutely loved it.  We both ordered drinks and were very impressed with them.
name: Kala

text: Long time lurker, first time poster.I'm excited to write my first review on a restaurant which didn't do everything perfectly, but I am ready to chalk it up to my poor decisions and new restaurant kinks and am already excited to visit again soon.Going on a Wednesday evening, the wait wasn't too terrible for a party of three, but luckily with the new Bottleworks nearby, finding a side activity or place to drink is pretty easy.Let's get to my least favorite things about this experience, cocktails and the appetizer. My cocktail was the Emerald Buddha, which was a vodka cocktail with lime and orange crema and lemongrass syrup among other garnishes. While the cocktail descriptor was far more eloquent, the drink was mediocre at best. It certainly didn't burn like a cheap vodka drink, but for all sorts of descriptors, the flavor should have been more robust than a bland citrusy vodka and tonic. Their beer list seemed pretty decent in regards to selection and variety, so this likely will be my drink choice for my next visit.The crab puffs were shared amongst our table, but they were really uninspiring, especially as a connoisseur of Chinese buffets. Maybe I was foolish for expecting something different.Luckily my Massaman curry hit out of the park. It was a "spicy" heat level, but blended the nutty sweetness, intense spices, and the richness of the coconut milk and braised beef that I added to it.Most importantly, our wonderful server, Austin, checked in on us appropriately throughout our night and joined our conversations seamlessly.
name: An

text: Such a beautiful spot! We sat outside on the patio and it was such a relaxing setting. The spring rolls with mushrooms were so TASTY! The portions are great and the food is amazing!
name: Alicia

text: Beware of the spice, the spicy is ACTUALLY very, very spicy. I am accustomed to eating authentically spicy food (I'm South Asian) on a regular basis and I was unable to finish my food. That being said, the vegan drunken noodles were absolutely delicious, and my partner got the regular drunken noodles with shrimp and he loved his too! Got the Thai iced tea cocktail and that was very good too.
name: Sally

text: TL;DR - Good, but somewhat forgettable. Skip the pad thai, definitely order a seasonal cocktail, and be prepared to wait. Pros: The service was wonderful and the drinks blew us away. I got a Thai Iced Tea that was wonderful and my partner ordered an Old Fashioned. The staff was incredibly friendly and sociable. Also, they offer a digitized wait list so that you can see where your party is at on the wait list and how long you've been waiting. Cons: The food didn't live up to the hype. It was good food, don't get me wrong, but my expectations were pretty high after hearing raving reviews from others. Also, we were quoted a 25-30 minute wait and we ended up waiting almost an hour. It's a pretty small place and it doesn't take reservations. While they do offer a digital, real-time wait list that you can view on your phone to see your place in line, the digital wait list doesn't provide a time estimate for the wait. (Which I do recognize is more of an art form rooted in experience rather than a science.)
name: Ashley
