text: Update:  After trying to get a seat at Bodhi several times unsuccessfully, we decided to get takeout and have gotten it several times over the last few months. The taste and quality is truly amazing. I just wish they had more seating!
name: Julie

text: Excellent atmosphere. Sat outside and it was wonderful. Service was excellent. Menu was varied without being overwhelming. I got stir fry. Too many onions which decreased my ability to eat the whole meal but very good. The bathrooms was single room style which was fine but I could not tell if I had the door locked so a little stressful. Over really good
name: Meredith

text: This restaurant is EPIC. Although a bit pricey and somewhat lower portions the service is always great. Both times I've been, the servers are very engaging and fun to talk to. They tend to recommend their favorites or even if you have a question they're always happy to answer. I definitely recommend the spring rolls which are fried perfection. It has veggies and glass noodles and are served with a sweet sauce. The shrimp cocktail is very delicious as well but I must say, the sauce it comes with is spicy! Both times I've gotten a variation of the OG Bodhi friend rice at a medium heat and I cannot express enough how delicious it is. The drinks are very fancy and pricey but will get you giggly. The vibes at this restaurant are very laid back, perfect for going with friends or on a date! I've sat outside both times and usually they have the fire pit going and cute little lights lit up outside. It's an experience and an honestly delicious place to try Thai food. I learned last time I was there that a Thai grandma is making the food. Def try this place at least once but you'll want to be back!
name: Ingrid

text: This is a hidden gem! We came here on a Saturday night for our anniversary and were able to get in after a short 10 min wait. We were quickly greeted by our server and he (Austin) made awesome recommendations. We each tried whiskey and gin cocktails from the menu that were great! We started off with the spring rolls which were delicious. My husband ordered the drunken noodles with chicken and I had the Thai basil stir fry with pork - both amazing! We will definitely be back for more drinks and Thai food. Thanks for the great service - it was definitely a breath of fresh air to get out and enjoy such a wonderful dinner.
name: Courtney

text: Bodhi. Hands down, the best Thai in the city - authentic, fresh and flavorful. Pen, Nicky and Taelor are delivering some savory masterpieces. What's more? Cocktails. We tried 3 of them; all amazing. The smoky mezcal drink with the flower was the best! Scaggs delivered great service all the while. Bonus feature? Outdoor seating replete with a fire pit. Thank you Bodhi team and welcome to your new home! - your new regular customers!
name: Blue

text: This is great food. We are missing Black Market something fierce, but Bisho is excellent. The food tastes great. My parang curry was some of the best I've had. Drinks could be more potent and brighter but they were good.
name: Rick

text: Fantastic new Thai restaurant in the old Black Market space. They are still adjusting to service, but everything was excellent. The food was well prepared, beautifully plated (I, regretfully, took zero pictures), and delicious. It was a bit busy for a Monday evening and their bartender was absolutely slammed, but when our cocktails did arrive they were beautiful, well crafted, and tasted fantastic. I recommend trying the signature Thai Iced Tea cocktail. Its a brilliant twist on one of my favorite drinks. It is a 21+ establishment, so it's perfect for a kid free occasion. Its no small feat to open a restaurant downtown, let alone during a global pandemic with so many extra precautions to take into account. Be patient if you go in the next few weeks as they find their rhythm and get into their groove. It may take longer than expected, but it is very much worth it.
name: Katie

text: This may be my favorite new Thai place! They have a great ambiance, good selection of cocktails and delicious food.  We got the tofu starter which my boyfriend doesn't even like tofu but loved it. We also got a curry and pad thai, both were delicious. They don't take reservations, but you can put your name in and wander down to the Garage for a drink while you wait!  Also parking can be tough near Bodhi, but if you park near Bottleworks and walk you shouldn't have any trouble!
name: Alexandra

text: I love Thai food. I think I saw this place from a Yelp photo and added it to the list of places to try! My boyfriend took me for my birthday last Thursday, and I honestly cannot wait to go back!! So we called the night before to make a reservation and unfortunately they don't take them. Planned on going early but some work stuff came up so we didn't get there until 7ish. They told us to eat inside it would be about 45-60 min, I didn't want to be cold in their outdoor area so we decided to wait and grabbed a drink nearby. After already waiting an hour we came back hoping our table would soon be ready. It's such a fun little space with great cocktail that the tables weren't turning. There we're three chairs we could wait on while waiting for the table and the hostess gave us a cocktail menu to get a drink. Gosh all their cocktails are SO FUN! I loved the two I had. Finally a table opened up and we got their order of spring rolls to start. They were so great and I especially loved the plum sauce that came with it. Now listen up, the main course is why I'll be trying to visit this place monthly. I love Massaman Curry and order it at every Thai restaurant I ever go to- this is the best I've ever had outside of Thailand! The flavor was just out of this world! It came with a side of naan bread, I honestly think I would have preferred rice I read to soak up all that incredible sauce. We would have stayed four dessert but it was already getting close to 10 and I had an early morning the next morning. Can't wait to go back. Tip if you don't want to wait- get there early!
name: Shelby

text: WOW! This place is exceptional- I would give it 6 stars if I could!! I had seen a lot about this restaurant on Instagram, and had really loved the past restaurant at that location, so I was excited to check it out- and I'm glad that I did! We got sat outside for an early dinner (around 4:30 on a Saturday) and there was really no one else there which was nice, it always looks very packed on Instagram. After looking at the menu, I still did not know what to order. When our waiter came, I asked for a cocktail and an entree recommendation. He asked me a couple questions about what I normally like, and found both a cocktail and an entree for me that were absolutely amazing. We also got an order or the crab puffs, which I will be dreaming of until my next trip back!! They were great. Overall amazing service, amazing food, amazing space. I can't wait to visit again, even if it's just for cocktails around their outdoor fire!
name: Renee

text: Tried the drunken noodles and a hazelnut dessert I can't remember the exact name of and a macaron type dessert.  All were very delicious!
name: Brandon

text: BODHI was just alright for me. I saw the high ratings and had higher expectations. We came on a Saturday night so it could have also played a factor in our experience.They don't take reservations so it was first come first serve walk in only. We probably waited close to 40-50 mins for our party of two.Once we were seated and placed our order, we probably waited another good 40-45 mins for our food to arrive.The laab salad was pretty good. I would probably order it again. My original intent was to order a papaya salad, but they said the owner who makes the dressing has been out and they were not able to sell it. I munched on the laab salad and another 30 minutes went by before our entrees arrived. I ordered the Tom kha soup with chicken. This one was just alright. Tasted mediocre. I've had Tom kha at so many different restaurants that this one really doesn't stand out. There was a candle underneath the pot, but other restaurants will serve it in an actual burner pot like for hot pot. The hype of BODHI is that it's on Massachusetts Ave and it's convenient and has a trendy interior and patio. Would I come back? If my group wants to go, I oblige, but I would probably not go out of my way to come here. Everything took way too long and was just mediocre. Again, it could have just been a fluke.
name: David

text: BEST THAI IN THE CITYDrinks amazing. Service amazing. Food to die for. It was a Saturday night at 7:30 and we got 2 bar seats for an anniversary dinner in 15 minutes. Would do again 100 times over.
name: Becca

text: This place is a gem!  The drinks are crazy good, and the outdoor area is beautiful.  The food is always on point, and I try not to stare too much at other people's plates to plan for the next visit.
name: Amber

text: I came here on a Tuesday evening with my friend. We each got 2 drinks. We sat outside and there was a DJ performing. The music got better as the night went on but it was a little loud for early in the evening. It was kind of hard to talk because the music was too loud. I got 2 drinks from the summer menu - the Phuket Pimm's Cup and Lost in Bangkok. I liked both but enjoyed the Phuket Pimm's Cup more. The place itself is cute and I liked the ambiance. However, the location itself was kind of weird. It's located across from a 24 hour hardware store and is nested in a corner.
name: Alexa

text: I had a great experience at BHODI. My fried rice with chicken hit the spot like comfort food, and the cocktail I had was the star of the meal. I got the Francoise & Etienne, with tangerine ice cubes. Nice.I look forward to going back again, maybe I'll get TWO cocktails and save room for dessert! YOLO!!
name: David

text: Overall, our group enjoyed our experience at BODHI. It's an attractive space, the table service was great, the drink menu is extensive, and the food was tasty. The criticisms I have that make this a 3-star review are all likely a result of growing pains, but need to be addressed nonetheless.When we first walked in the door, we stood at the host stand for a solid 5 minutes or so without being acknowledged by anyone in any way. I believe the person who was acting as host was also the manager and also trying to help with running food, which is understandable. The bigger issue is that there were plenty of other employees around who definitely were aware of us and didn't bother to tell us that someone would be with us shortly. That's pretty fundamental training to provide to your restaurant staff so that someone doesn't feel ignored at a host stand long enough to start to wonder if they're in the right spot or if you need to seat themselves. Ultimately, not a huge deal, but not a great start.After we put our names in, we supplied our phone number and were told that it would be an hour wait. No problem. We wandered over to the nearby food hall and grabbed a drink. I started to get nervous around the hour mark though and suggested to our group that we head back and check on the table just in case. When we got back, we were told that our table was ready, and the host seemed concerned that we hadn't received a call. Again, not a huge deal, and likely not anyone's fault in the restaurant. But this is for sure something that needs to be figured out.When we sat down, our server greeted us relatively quickly given how busy he was, and we were all excited by both the food and drink menus. We ordered our drinks and asked questions about the standards they use to set the spice levels (spicy food lovers know why this is important!). We also ordered an appetizer that our server forgot to enter in and didn't come out until after our entrees had. Another small but not ideal issue.The final concern is probably the most relevant to people looking to eat here. While our server did a great job explaining the spice levels, when our food came out, the heat was very inconsistent between the dishes. Their spice levels are indicated by a chili pepper symbol with the following scale:1-Mild2-Medium3-Spicy4-Extra SpicyEveryone in our group wanted a good amount of spice in their food, but didn't want it overly intense. We were told a 3 would be that range, so we all ordered 3 across two orders of drunken noodles, one panang curry, and one chili & basil stir fry.My friend had the curry, and I had the stir fry. We both like a good amount of spice and were struggling just a few bites into our meal. The food was good enough that we both finished, but we hadn't wanted to be that uncomfortable as we ate. Meanwhile, our partners who had both gotten the drunken noodles didn't feel that their dishes were very spicy at all. Now, you could chalk this up to spice levels affecting dishes differently, which happens, but it didn't even seem to be consistent between them. I tasted my wife's (I should clarify that I tasted her leftovers the next day since I was in no position to gauge a lack of spice during our meal!), and it was more in line with what I would have wanted at a 3. Meanwhile, the other person in the group that had ordered the noodles said it was barely spicy at all. This is something that definitely needs to be sorted because food being more or less spicy than you like is a potentially meal-ruining experience.Everything said, there's nothing that we didn't enjoy about our experience here that can't be fixed. We look forward to coming back after a while and trying it again. Might ask if they can do 2.5 chilis...
name: Pat

text: I loved my steak salad and my wife's Massaman curry is the best I have tasted in the City!
name: Alijandro

text: I have never written a poor review for a restaurant, and I really was looking forward to dining here. I had heard such great things about this place, but the unprofessionalism and health safety concerns were too much to not share. If you don't read this entire review, just know: Do NOT come here if there's even a chance of rain! They sat us outside right before a thunderstorm. When we asked what they were planning on doing as we had just got there when it started raining, they told us we were welcome to stand in the doorway and eat our food standing (?). I felt bad for my server who was clearly flustered and had no idea what to do. When we stood in the doorway, the bartender told us that we couldn't stay in there and was confused that someone had told us we could. Back out in the rain we went. Our server told us that there was a spot underneath a birds nest we could sit at but warned us about the bird crap. There was dried bird crap next to us on our table that they didn't bother to wipe up. Before we left they gave us literal dish towels to put on our heads. Food was pricey but good. I could've gotten the same food at Thaitanium for much less, and maybe sans bird crap.
name: Erin

text: Come for cocktails on the patio.  The food is ok at best and overpriced for average Thai which typically is made from fresh ingredients most anywhere.  I guess I was expecting a unique spin on Thai food...some sort of fusion or not regular items you'd find at every other Thai restaurant around.  Highly recommend the specialty cocktails...the Phaya Naga is fantastic (if you like a good smoky mezcal cocktail)!  We ordered the spring rolls, drunken noodles and massaman curry.  The spring rolls and drunken noodles were nothing to write home about and were actually not as good as the ones we had gotten when we ordered takeout from Thai Garden in Fishers a week earlier.  The drunken noodles were very light on noodles...perhaps since the flat noodles are house made, they skimp on the portion served.  I had never tasted a massaman curry...the braised beef was tender and perfectly braised, however I didn't care for the sweetness in the spices of that particular curry.Came during off peak on a Wednesday around 5:30 to beat the long wait times since they don't take reservations and we were seated right away.  Service was great.
name: Elle
